entry.title: Columba-- Dovecote
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 117,165Chapters: 21/24Kudos: 182

Summary: Buck held the little plastic bird close in front of his eyes, twisting it back and forth. “You can say it, Buck,” Eddie encouraged, quietly. “To put it out there in… the universe. And you’ll see her tomorrow, anyway.” “I think…” Buck took a huge breath, breathing deep into his chest, past the hurt, past the hard rock of anxiety that sat at its center, past the tears welling in his eyes; he aimed all of it back out, straight into the heart of the deep, deep universe. “I think I met my daughter tonight.”   or; A work of fate or God or man or the universe crosses the paths of Buck and a small, green-eyed girl with a bird in her palm and the future in her snaggle-toothed grin. Two and a half years after the events of Lighthouse, the Diazes become the Diazes.

entry.title: A Noble Sacrifice
entry.summary:
Author: Chromedove

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,582Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 77

Summary: Eddie practically raised his sisters, always putting their needs above his own, even at great personal cost. Now, years later, and recovering from being shot, he’s still struggling to put himself first. When Sophia arrives for a surprise Christmas visit, she brings with her long-forgotten memories and reminders of the sacrifices Eddie has made—hoping to help her brother finally realize that he, too, deserves happiness.Apparently, this comes with realizing that maybe him and Buck have deeper connections than they originally thought...

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 122,160Chapters: 21/?Kudos: 14

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 138,422Chapters: 21/?Kudos: 42

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: What Died Didn't Stay Dead (Your Alive Your Alive)
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_Butterflies

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 55,141Chapters: 11/12Kudos: 389

Summary: “I am looking for the Captain of this firehouse,” he heard the voice say.   He heard Tommy say, “Oh, you must be the person replacing me. Let me get Captain Nash for you.” He was friendly, but Bobby could hear a hint of mockery in that response. “You said Captain Nash?” the voice said, and without a doubt Bobby knew by the way he said his last name who was standing down in that bay and wasn’t going to be sticking around. He dropped the spoon he was stirring with, and it crashed to the ground as he bolted from around the counter towards the edge of the loft. “Buck,” he yelled, and the man with his back towards him kept walking. He started to take the stairs, and the figure kept walking, “Buck.” He could hear Hen and Chimeny following and saying, “Who is Buck?” but he didn’t have time to explain. He said the kid’s name several more times as he reached the bottom of the stairs. And when the figure was almost out of the firehouse doors, Bobby finally used his fatherly voice and yelled, “EVAN JAMES BUCKLEY YOU BETTER TURN YOUR ASS AROUND RIGHT NOW.” The figure stopped moving, but he did not turn around.   CHAPTER 11 PART 2 AND PART 3 iS NOW UP TOO

entry.title: you could be my baby, baby, baby
entry.summary:
Author: Elgney

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 54,709Chapters: 8/10Kudos: 697

Summary: “My mom said, uh, that his name was Buck. That he was going to go to the fire academy and that he had a—” she broke off, rubbing her own forehead, exactly where his skin went pink. “She said he went by Firehose.” Buck didn’t need all of his coworkers to look at him in alarm; he was pretty sure he’d gone deadly pale. His daughter knew four things about him, and one of them was his old tinder profile handle. He felt a little like he was going to die. “She’s got your eyes,” Eddie commented, unhelpfully. ---- Buck finds out he has a daughter, and also a stupidly big crush on his best friend. It's an adjustment.

entry.title: Don't Change a Thing
entry.summary:
Author: writingamarie

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 72,105Chapters: 9/22Kudos: 29

Summary: Eddie Diaz was coming home. He'd spent months in Texas trying to repair things with Chris and finally the two of them were on their way back to LA. With Chris's only two demands being 1. Eddie gives him total honesty moving forward and 2. Eddie doesn't explore whatever Chris witnessed between him and Buck while they were all in Texas. And Eddie had every intention of following his son's requirements for returning home... but intentions and actions aren't always the same thing. Buck is there and helpful and kind in a way Eddie can't ignore. He can't deny what he'd finally let himself feel down in Texas. But he can't break his son's trust either.Buck is busy trying to build a life Eddie and Chris will be happy to be a part of in LA. He's ready and willing to move on from his traumatic year and wants to open himself up to the possibility of what might be developing right in front of him.  Part Two of a three-part series where Eddie must leave everything behind, fight to find his way back, and discover if true joy is even possible—or if it’s already too late.

entry.title: the ghost of you
entry.summary:
Author: undertheseaweed

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,078Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 159

Summary: Eddie turned again, faster this time, just in time to see the letter H wobble and settle into place next to an I. HI Eddie blinked. For a long time, it felt as if he didn’t breathe. His hands curled into fists at his sides, not from anger, but something close. Something tangled in disbelief and fear and grief and the desperate, irrational hope he couldn’t let himself feel. “Nope,” he said firmly to the empty kitchen. “Nope, nope, absolutely not.”

entry.title: Courtside Hearts”
entry.summary:
Author: villayuly1987

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,065Chapters: 11/11Kudos: 66

Summary: Evan ” Nash: A dedicated personal fitness trainer in Los Angeles. He’s raising his 7-year-old daughter, Robyn Nash, who is independent, kind, and surprisingly protective of the people she cares about.“Eddie” Diaz: A disciplined but warm basketball coach for one of the biggest LA teams. He balances the spotlight of his career with raising his 6-year-old son, Christopher Diaz, who is bright, determined, and lives with cerebral palsy.Robyn and Christopher meet in elementary school. They click instantly—Christopher feels safe knowing Robyn “has his back,” while Robyn feels like she’s finally found someone who understands her quiet strength. She instinctively steps in to help him when he gets tired, not out of pity but out of loyalty. Their friendship becomes the bridge that ties their fathers together.Unlike canon, Buck and Eddie don’t know each other through the firehouse. Their worlds collide through their kids’ school events—science fairs, basketball practice, and the chaotic magic of parent-teacher nights.
